newsitem.title: UK: Euro VGO holds as US arb window creaks half-open.
newsitem.headline: Euro VGO holds as US arb window creaks half-open.

text.p: European VGO markets held steady at end-week as recovering markets in the U.S. half-opened the trans-atlantic arbritage window.
"The arbitrage is much better than earlier this week, we are maybe just one or two dollars away from being able to do it," said one VGO trader.
He estimated the break-even point netted back into Europe was around $126 fob for low sulphur cargoes.
"Especially if you are working on the 70/30 formula and can bet on the price evolving the right way between now and arrival you might just be able to do it," he continued.
But other traders said only low sulphur demand had recovered to the U.S., with high and medium still weak.
A low sulphur cargo bought from a Spanish refinery by a trader earlier this week was heard passed on to a U.S. major, at around -6.75 delivered.
Otherwise business was quiet, with some high sulphur cargoes seen available in Europe. Recent west African low sulphur cargoes were reported already headed to the U.S., though not necessarily placed.
